Review.Titre: Stole my $ and cancelled my subscription! STAY AWAY!
Review.Contenu: I highly suggest steering clear of Gaia. I joined last month and was charged 3 times for 1 billing period.  I emailed the company and instead of working with me to find a solution they discontinued my account and have not responded to any of my emails.  They did refund me for 1 of the 3 charges they took from my account however I think $30 (the cost of 2 months of subscription in a perfect world) is a bit steep for the 3 days I was able to access the site.  Absolutely horrible customer service if you can even call it that.

Review.Titre: Double charged - poor customer service
Review.Contenu: A streaming spiritual platform is great and they deliver on that, 5 star there. However, good luck if you ever need customer service. I was double charged for months and still havent been helped to get it resolved. Paying for the service via apple subscriptions then randomly charged again by Gaia.com. They dont have a customer service number so you submit issues via a bot and hope someone will get back to you. At the end of the day the product is great but the service is poor and thats enough for me to not use again.

Review.Titre: Gaia overcharged me and refused to…
Review.Contenu: Gaia overcharged me and refused to refund. I paid for one month and was charged for three months. Sure there is small print stating they would be recharging every month but this is not always clear. They can see if I had not used it in the months I was overcharged but refunded to give me my money back. I have been a loyal annual subscriber in the past but now they will never get another penny off me. Their customer service is as poor as their business strategy if they think this is an acceptable way to retain annual subscribers.

Review.Titre: I cancelled by phone last year
Review.Contenu: I cancelled by phone last year, but they billed me again the following year. I only found out when looking at credit card statement. Said I was stuck with them for another year. Said there is no month to month option. This seems like a strong arm tactic in this instance. a few months in I would probably been ok but in this case it is not right. Now I have to waste my time with reviews and legal principal.

Review.Titre: AVOID
Review.Contenu: AVOID! CANCELLED MY ACCOUNT THREE TIMES AND THEY CONTINUE TO CHARGE ME. ABSOLUTE SCAMMERS MASQUERADING AS A SPIRITUAL COMPANY.

Review.Contenu: I'm disappointed for my response from Gaia about my overcharged services I didn't ask for. This type of platform should believe their customers. We are all souls here for an amazing experience trying to learn more from this platform.  I told the truth and did not upgrade my subscription I just purchased a basic package in June. Now if I don't keep my basic subscription they will not reimburse me my money They took for an upgrade I did not sign up for. That's sad...just another controlled platform.

Review.Titre: Credit card company had to assist in getting my money back !!
Review.Contenu: Ordered some trainers almost two months ago and was told eight days for delivery. Fobbed off over and over again and trainers never arrived and no refund despite several requests. Eventually got my credit card company involved and they managed to get my money back after eight weeks of waiting. Lucky that one star is an option because would have been zero given a choice. Be aware !!

Review.Titre: Sketchy company...
Review.Contenu: I signed up for a one-week free trial, found the content wasn't for me, and was charged $100 for a one-year subscription. I contacted the billing department less than five days after the charge and they refused to refund me per their policy (this is way, way down in the policy document, and almost everybody doesn't read the fine print). In our current economy, this policy is vile. I've never seen such a policy from any company, ever. I feel like I got scammed/stolen from. Won't be recommending Gaia to anyone I know.

Review.Titre: "best ancient history documentaries"…
Review.Contenu: "best ancient history documentaries" It's all very silly conspiracy theories for very silly people. Had a good laugh, don't know how the people making these can believe themselves.

Review.Titre: I opened my mind to Gaia and I have to say...
Review.Contenu: Gaia has spent a great deal of time and effort putting all of this content together, but the problem is this - absolutely none of their mystical claims has an association with this thing we call 'truth'. Not even a sliver of it. How do I know? Because if any of it were demonstrably true they wouldn't need to create this walled garden that has been fashioned solely to quash challenges to their assertions. It would just be mainstream news. Mainstream, accepted science. And yet you won't hear anything about these discoveries from long-regarded journals or media outlets. They're counting on gullible seekers to pay for their comfortable lifestyles. Don't be the sucker paying your hard-earned money to people who know just as much as you do.

Review.Titre: I signed up for a free trial to watch…
Review.Contenu: I signed up for a free trial to watch the Codex series but was frustrated by the speed and lack of clarity of the pictorial assertions the narrator made so decided that this was not for me and watched nothing more. I had intended to cancel but got mixed up with timezone dates and learned this morning that I had been billed. I immediately cancelled the description but it's another Amazon et al scam that makes you sign up for a free trial but does not advise or warn of an impending bill. This unethical behaviour makes me resent everything that comes from America, especially your spelling. If a company is unethical about it's billing, I suspect the integrity and veracity of it's information.

Review.Titre: Deserves 0 stars
Review.Contenu: The material on Gaia is available on other sites, including free websites like youtube. Most of the material that is uniquely Gaia's is outlandish, and conspiracy theory related. Fun to visit occasionally, but not worth a membership. My spouse was really curious about Gaia, so I purchased the annual membership, which is more than $44 less than purchasing it monthly. I was not impressed with the material, and decided to cancel after 3 months. I was informed on their website that they wouldn't refund me for the unused 9 months, but that I still had to keep the membership. In their words, "rest assured, you will have access until the year membership ends." Wow, thanks Gaia, I can access your website that I don't want to access because you won't determine the prorated amount for a proper refund. The other streaming websites will let you cancel, so I am unsure why a streaming platform that claims to be spiritually guided adheres to capitalism 101, instead. If I could give 0 stars, that would be the real review.When I contacted customer service, they repeatedly quoted their website that they don't issue any partial refunds and that I had to keep the service. When I asked to speak to management, the request was ignored, multiple times

Review.Titre: I have signed up to Gaia
Review.Contenu: I have signed up to Gaia, so that i can track all the latest for Joe Dispenza on a monthly basis subscription. But guess what...you have to pay additional to watch it. The rest of the videos available at the app are useless, same video can easilty be found on youtube for free.

Review.Titre: Terrible tech support. I quit.
Review.Contenu: I’ve been a Gaia customer for over 3 years. Recently I’ve had a problem streaming videos-they all start at the end and I cannot restart them. Instead I have rewind each streaming video like it’s the 1980s. I contacted Gaia support. For the first 3 emails they dismissed my ticket because they didn’t understand what I was asking. Then they asked me for information and asked me to send a video. Finally, after over a week of wasting my time with emails in the middle of the night (because obviously their tech support is overseas) they told me to buy a new device. Instead I’m cancelling my membership and I’ll get streaming yoga videos from another service.

Review.Titre: Gaia Tv merged and it is not the same- PS Customer Service doesn’t refund
Review.Contenu: A couple of years ago Gaia Tv merged  with another company that I had been using. The app went from practical cooking classes to abstract movies with minimal workout classes. Not my thing. I thought I had canceled my subscription. As it turns out on 4/1 I was charged for an annual subscription. I requested a termination and a refund. I was told they would terminate my account, but not refund me. I have not used the service in years. VERY disappointed in customer service. I will not be using the platform any more and will be sure to share my “customer service” experience with all. What a waste of $110. DO NOT USE GAIA. Not worth it.

Review.Titre: If you are vulnerable gaia wants your money
Review.Contenu: If you are vulnerable thats what gaia specialises in, making money out of you while giving you access to content made mostly by scientific outliers with questionable knowledge and deeply suspect pasts. This is yet another extension of the USA-led 'alternative healthcare' trillion-dollar market, they will sell anything to anyone as long as it makes money. Honestly, just do more exercise, take up the piano, sniff less cocaine, and read more proper books as opposed to self-improvement twaddle. you'll feel better for it and wont be lining the pockets of tin-pot 'experts'.

Review.Titre: STAY FAR AWAY!
Review.Contenu: I bought a subscription via Amazon Prime and cancelled over a year ago.  I ended up finding out that they were STILL taking money out of my account even though I had cancelled. They said it was because it was cancelled with Amazon but not with them.  Do they seriously think that someone that bought a subscription via Amazon, and cancels via Amazon, still wants access just not via Amazon?  I was under the impression that I did not have access to Gaia all this time due to the emails I received!  I sent them an email about it requesting a refund of everything they have automatically taken out of my account that was not authorized.  They sent this to me in response: "Please note that Amazon Video is a separate membership to Gaia. It is a separate subscription, billed separately from Gaia.com offerings.  I understand your situation and as a one-time courtesy, we would be glad to refund your account for the last charge. Your account has been canceled and your refund will be processed by our team within the next 48 hours.SO, just the "last charge" as a "one-time-courtesy"?  I cannot believe a "spiritual" business is operating this way!  A courtesy would have been to not take any additional money from me after I cancelled!

Their New Age programming is not even worth the annual fee anyway, the quality of the offerings is poor, the customer service is terrible, and they will try to rip you off.

Review.Titre: Be careful they will ask you to sign up…

When I watch on Chromecast, it doesn't automatically put on the next episode. When I watch in a browser, it goes out of Fullscreen mode between each episode. It also doesn't adhere to the standards set by most videoplayers, like left-click anywhere on the image to pause.

Review.Titre: Gaia is not customer friendly.
Review.Contenu: I purchased the Gaia app about 3 weeks ago. The app has some great content, but something within their app causes the battery life on my phone to get used up extremely fast. More concerning is that my phone gets very hot when I use this app. I have a brand new phone, Samsung S21 and the thing is like a computer.  But Gaia did not help with this issue. When I asked for a refund, they refused saying that they don't provide refunds ( its in the fine print). So I wasted $99 on a product that does not deliver what they promised. I want to warn anyone who is thinking about downloading this app to beware.

Review.Contenu: I use on my Fire Stick 4k and sadly it is not very user friendly and hard to navigate. I recommend trying to mirror to Netflix or YouTube the best you legally can. I had emailed customer service about this and even recommended being able to categorize our playlist (such as setting a folder for just meditation, food etc.) and after a year of being a member, it's the same exact platform. There's not much innovation to Gaia's platform and appears outdated at times.

Review.Contenu: I love the content which is the only reason I have not canceled my subscription. The service absolutely sucks!! It’s non existent. I have had many times when it just won’t play and I have to try again later and hope for the best. Meanwhile Netflix ect works fine. I reported this and got no response from the “team” at Gaia very disappointed. I may end up sadly canceling if there is not improvement

Review.Titre: I was pretty disappointed when I signed…
Review.Contenu: I was pretty disappointed when I signed up for the annual membership and the videos were extremely limited. They want you to pay almost $300 to access just a few videos which is absolutely ridiculous. The billing practices are questionable as well as I still have not heard back from customer service regarding a full refund.

Review.Titre: Gaia seems to have opened up and…
Review.Contenu: Gaia seems to have opened up and swallowed a big dose of Corporate.  Programming is not as accessible as it was and the main person I opened an account to see has become very different.  I can barely watch him interact with his one-time protégé. I would have never suspected him capable of such pettiness.  His hostility is palpable and I'm actually considering closing this account because of him. What a disappointment.

Review.Titre: It's like paying full price for a car to discover you don't get the wheels or the engine to go with it.
Review.Contenu: I live in the UK. There is a huge amount of content I would love to watch on Gaia, but am blocked from doing so because Gaia has not licensed it for viewing in the UK. Despite this, I have to pay full price. Other countries pay the same, but are able to watch ALL the content. Gaia needs to sort out its pricing to reflect that not all content is available. ]It's like paying full price for a car to discover you don't get the wheels or the engine to go with it.

Review.Titre: For the pass 2 weeks I've been…
Review.Contenu: For the pass 2 weeks I've been experiencing issues with the Gaia channel on my Roku. The issue, while viewing a program, the picture would go out but the audio would remain. At this time I would get a message on my screen asking me to contact Gaia support. I've been working with Marianthe from the support team and so far no solution has resolve my issue. That's why I've rated you 2 starts. Otherwise, it would have been 5...

Review.Titre: Navigating through your shows is cumbersome.
Review.Contenu: Navigating through your available shows is cumbersome. Often when you leave a show you have to come back and search for it. You need to organize the way shows are accessed and keep member previews and views separate and remember where I left off when I log back in. Comments on your shows is unique but there seems to be no way of knowing whether people view your comments or and if they are deleted. To search for a past comnent on an episode is very painful to search .

Review.Titre: Very slow website
Review.Contenu: The website is sooooo slow, it has a lot of bugs. The documentaries don't load fast enough and sometimes the audio and image are not in sync (this is not a wifi problem from my end because it has happened from different devices and different connections and is obviously a recurring problem). Their content is great but half of the time it takes so much time to load that I don't even feel like watching anymoreThe customer service is alright but I feel like they don't know what they're doing. I tried asking them to log out from other devices and they couldn't help me. They still have a long way to go.

Review.Titre: I wanted to watch Ancient Civilisation…
Review.Contenu: I wanted to watch Ancient Civilisation on Gaia, but they its BS, while they do come up with some information and even theories that makes good sense, so much of it is garbage. And thats sad cause there is a lot of important stuff we need to figure out about our past....

Review.Titre: My truth. From aunt Ruth.
Review.Contenu: I was obsessed with Gaia almost immediately! It’s so wonderful having a platform for open minds. Speaking of open minds, that my most loved program on Gaia. Unfortunately for the cost there isn’t enough information FOR ME. Within a month I have caught up on everything which trulyInterested me, and that’s Listening between 2-3 hours a day. Which can be considered ALOT! I loved to listen before bed and focused on expanding thoughts rather than watching tv to fill my time. -aunt Ruth

Review.Titre: I don't like it that I keep getting…
Review.Contenu: I don't like it that I keep getting logged off on my roku.  It's very tedious to log back in and since i'm old i keep forgetting my password and i keep having to request a reset.  It's really annoying.  I have to reset my password one more time I'm sure I will just cancel my subscription.  Thank you.

Review.Titre: I trust Gaia to lead us in a world…
Review.Contenu: I trust Gaia to lead us in a world where there can potentially be charlatans. I had readings with two different people who claimed that they had access to the answers to the universe. They did not. I tried to tell Gaia, they were not interested in my feedback.

Review.Titre: I love Gaia and the programs  I…
Review.Contenu: I love Gaia and the programs  I continue to have access problems.  Once again--problem is a new one--I can get Gaia on my TV-ROKU but now I can get as far as selecting a program but it will not load.  Just get a continuing rotating merkaba symbol. Otherwise I LOVE the programing.  Just not the access problems. Thanks

Review.Titre: I'm trying to get on and I'm on your…
Review.Contenu: I'm trying to get on and I'm on your site but nothing will play I have gone into different series and still nothing. I pay the most for this channel then I do for CBS monthly! When it doesn't work or all the stuff is old and not very current it's disappointing. I thinking of just getting rid of this!

Review.Titre: New user interface needs work
Review.Contenu: Since they changed the user interface at the end of last year, service has been terrible.  Scrolling through the shows has become more cumbersome. I know my shows by the picture on the video, not by the name.  With the old interface, you could see more of the upcoming video options, with the new interface, you can only see five videos at a time.  We have had trouble with Gaia loading at times, it shuts down completely and goes back to the Roku home page.We love the options of all the yoga videos.

Review.Titre: Fall in program quality and variety
Review.Contenu: Program quality and variety declined in the year I was a member as production values on Gaia's flagship program Cosmic Disclosure increased. Gaia programs support Wilcock's theories in their "Ancient Aliens" approach and seem hostile to a more esoteric explanation of myth. Viewers are assured of an impending apocalypse through a solar flash and salvation through ascension. All detractors of the official narrative are deemed "haters." Do we really need a new corporate religion?

Review.Titre: Runs out of steam so it’s overpriced compared to other providers.
Review.Contenu: You can immerse yourself in old programming for a while. But then new material is focused mainly on questionable yoga and outer space conspiracy programs. If they halved the price it would be an interesting novelty subscription. However, there is little curation for quality here — open season like a version of “National Inquirer”. Don’t get me wrong, it is entertaining, but they promote it as if it should be the end all and do all of spiritual and philosophical inquiry, and it is really more of a Barnes And Baileys Road Show.

Review.Titre: The content is pretty similar
Review.Contenu: The content is pretty similar, not a lot of new things going on and a lot of repetition. Documentaries are not super good quality in terms of narrative / art direction... some are hard to engage to... Then the interface is not intuitive, hard to navigate and hard to save stuff and watch later... a lot of back and forth... I like the idea of gaia but the execution could be done better specially since it is payed content, I DON'T MIND PAYING but i find better material at free platforms where the navigation and experience is even better so I am wondering If I should stay at all...

Review.Titre: In this age when people are finding it…
Review.Contenu: In this age when people are finding it very difficult to separate truth from fiction, content like (much of) yours only serves to confuse people further. Focus on building critical thinking skills instead of filling viewers' heads with pseudo-science.

Review.Titre: Without a search button like you use to…
Review.Contenu: Without a search button like you use to have, I find it is almost impossible  to find things .   All those stars just a distraction.  Look pretty but get in way.  Nothing about your site  is user friendly.If you wanted us to be informed rather than your tool for money collection & information control you would have  set it up differently.  I us it less & less  Do you want us to be informed or are you out to make money only?  To do any serious exploration one must go elsewhere.Very disappointed!!

Review.Titre: I only watched because of David Wilcock
Review.Contenu: I only watched because of David Wilcock and then Corey Goode after he became a whistle blower.  I have not watched Gaia TV since Mr. Wilcock left.  If beings/individuals that are service to self did take over Gaia TV, it is sad.  However, they shall not win the war.  WWG1WGA.

Review.Titre: I love some of the content but finding…
Review.Contenu: I love some of the content but finding programs to watch is difficult because there are so many topics; most if which is not intereststing to my husband and I. We would love fir Gaia to suggest great options based on our interests. Also, send an email or an app notification if something we might like is showing. I love Gaia so much that I bought stock in the company! I'm hoping you guys can make it so that your members go to your app first before trying Netflix, m cable, hulu, etc. it was like that for us at first but now Gaia has become a last resort ☹️

Review.Titre: A fraud - company charges regardless of cancelling membership
Review.Contenu: The program is acceptable, video quality is average not enough to pay a 10 euro monthly fee. Most videos are found on youtube.My 2 star rating is for the customer support. I cancelled the memberships couple of days signing up for trial membership. Gaia charged my credit card regardless, I reached out to customer support and it took them 14 days to respond. I was told a refund is on the way, 3 days later there is no refund and only to find out in the mean time they charged me again. Beware that if you sign up for the trial, you might be stuck with the monthly fees.

Review.Titre: This is a great platform in theory
Review.Contenu: This is a great platform in theory, but I find it’s lacking up to date and well designed content. I wish I had access to more videos that didn’t look like they were made in the 80s

Review.Titre: Normally I do not have an issue with…
Review.Contenu: Normally I do not have an issue with the streaming but today, January 4, 2020, it is terrible. I have closed out of the app a couple of times but this is not helping. I use Roku and am not having an issue with the other apps. Last week Roku wanted me to get Gaia through them and I thought this was you so I signed up even though the price was more.  I contacted you and explained the situation and you kindly said to cancel through Roku and continue on like I normally do to pay you directly. Don't laugh, but could Roku be doing this because I cancelled with them?  I know this sounds silly but who knows?

Review.Titre: I love the content, terrible support!
Review.Contenu: I love the content. However, I am having payment issues - changed my visa card, now the amounts are being withdrawn but no access. I submitted a comment through the site, only received a computer-generated response. It's been 4 days!

Review.Titre: It seemed like all of the videos I…
Review.Contenu: It seemed like all of the videos I picked were severely dated.  I have no desire to work out with someone in 80s jazzercize attire.  Also, the Alien videos that kept showing on my main page as recommendations were just weird.

Review.Titre: Not wry Happy with the new content
Review.Contenu: I’ve subscribed for years with Gaia. But your content has changed and is not as innovative, current,and not as interesting. It looks like you are going through a programming transition, but I am considering canceling my subscription.

Review.Titre: Mostly woo-woo content
Review.Contenu: It's mostly woo-woo BS pretending to be spiritual. To be fair, maybe about 10% of its content is good, but definitely not worth it. To much silly, misleading and sometimes totally ridiculous content.

Review.Titre: The new Gaia is too hard to navigate
Review.Contenu: The new Gaia is too hard to navigate. I am lost. The same video is listed 3 to 5 times. I cannot tell when or if I have watched a video. It would be nice to know when the video was recorded and when I viewed it.Sorry, just frustrated.

Review.Titre: Why won't Gaia respond to the poor reviews?
Review.Contenu: I was considering signing up, but there are so many reviews about poor customer service and questionable billing practices, and Gaia has not responded to these.  So there is no way I'm going to try this service.

Review.Titre: not able to watch on tv
Review.Contenu: The content is very interesting, but I cant watch in on my samsung tv, I have tried, and it has been impossible. The content could be the best but if i cant watch on my tv, i rather not have the subscription.

Review.Titre: First contact oh this is going to be…
Review.Contenu: First contact oh this is going to be good i thought no Bulshit story. I was really hoping after my Military duty and flying Helos. Well much to my Disappointment here we go again.

Review.Titre: I joined Gaia but after a couple of…
Review.Contenu: I joined Gaia but after a couple of months I realised that unfortunately I did not have time to enjoy the content of the website due to very busy daily schedule. I tried to cancel my subscription 2 or 3 times and every time there was a technical issue, and 2-3 times I have emailed to explain the issue and to seek support in cancelling the subscription. Clearly I was charged every month and received no support whatsover (answer to my emails). I am leaving the 2-star review because this is not an adequate customer support and the problem is not in the $10 I was charged over the course of a few months, it's a matter of principle and to underline the importance of at least baseline customer support :)

Review.Titre: I have remained on Gaia despite its many flaws.
Review.Contenu: I have remained on Gaia, and continue with the subscription despite serious misgivings about the integrity of the organization.  I truly enjoy George because he takes on all aspects, asks neutral questions, elicits evocative responses and does not judge or interject. Wilcock and Goode are fun, and interesting, if not always accurate. Meredith drives me nuts with her interruptions. Others (Stone, Dolan, Howe) seem to fall off the screen without a clue. But what has disturbed me most is the Nazca report that had about 8 episodes - then nothing. No explanation, no admission of fake, nothing.  I will continue to watch, but Gaia is a limping, questionable, uneasy, self-discrediting source, which has disappointed me greatly.

Review.Titre: The reason I subscribed to Gaia was to…
Review.Contenu: The reason I subscribed to Gaia was to be able to have access to Leslie Sansone's exercise programs. You no longer have any Leslie Sansone programs. There will be no reason for me to renew next year.

Review.Titre: There is not enough new material
Review.Contenu: There is not enough new material, now that I have watched so much, I tune in and look for something new, unfortunately I dont find much current new veiwing. Still enjoy the yoga and pilates very much.

Review.Titre: Has some good shows
Review.Contenu: Has some good shows, but was founded by very a evil person Jirka Rysavy who has a reptilian soul. Reptilian souls don't have empathy for others and when they rape children receive special energy.

Review.Titre: Gaia has a lot of great and interesting…
Review.Contenu: Gaia has a lot of great and interesting content, which makes me want to at least give them 3 stars. Nonetheless, most seem to be geared towards pseudoscience. Although they present evidence, the evidence is still sketchy:  reading the book "The Demon-Haunted World: Science as a Candle in the Dark" might help in understanding what I mean. Since I'm new to what is scientific, I might not know how to express myself as coherently as someone else. But the need for understanding science in a realistic way is what drives me to be passionate about the subject. Perhaps the Gaia crew can refute the book if they don't agree with it, so that viewers/readers can really understand Gaia's viewpoint outside of what is most intriguing -- and more geared toward the truth.

Review.Titre: There is a lot of fake acting and pre…
Review.Contenu: There is a lot of fake acting and pre arranged information. I pray Gaia doesn't go "mainstream",  not to mention way over priced

Review.Titre: I have had to reset my password…
Review.Contenu: I have had to reset my password unexpectedly. I have to spend time searching for yoga sessions to fit my time. Playlist is hard to find. It takes too long to find a yoga session that I want.

Review.Titre: not enough new material
I find the content not interesting…
Review.Contenu: I find the content not interesting enough.Like the subjects very much, but the programs themselves are not as deep as I expected. Would also love to have Hebrew subtitles.

Review.Titre: My preferred method of using the Gaia…
Review.Contenu: My preferred method of using the Gaia channel is my Roku device. The Roku Gaia channel app works approximately 1 out of 5 times, which is a crappy statistic. That 1 out of 5 times that it works is a grueling wait for the content to load and perform. I use my computer and chrome cast to the tv when the Roku version won't operate. The website works 3.5 out of 5 times. I would prefer to use Roku as I am using the channel mostly for yoga at home and it is a super cool feature to be able to pause with the remote, in the middle of a session without having to move from position much. The app layout is super awesome, content is super awesome. I am totally hooked and use the Gaia channel almost every single day. Totally looking forward to the app improving in functional ability.

Review.Titre: Customer service was excellent for most…
Review.Contenu: Customer service was excellent for most of 2018.  Suddenly Gaia stopped answering their phones around the start of 2019. There is a discrepancy in billing and they will not answer emails nor have I been able to reach them via telephone after over half a dozen, if not a dozen attempts.The loss of David Wilcock turned out worse than I anticipated. I wasn't concerned with Gaia being capable of still putting together great content with intelligent interviews.  However, that hasn't been the case. Gaia is a great concept, showed great potential and had wonderful customer service.  At this point, I hope they make it and get back to being a great source for valuable information.  I don't generally watch Gaia for movies. The movies are "B" grade at best and rarely updated.

Review.Titre: Way too much bamboozling
Review.Contenu: I love your yoga and exercise videos. Top notch! However, for me, it’s a little New age and sometimes a little over the top. Although i respect others beliefs, I prefer more traditional Spiritual topics. I’m uneasy about some programs such as Cosmic Disclosure, igiving scenarios that are not only frightening but could mislead a lot of people who are gullible. It appears irresponsible. For instance, Jason Rice, Corey Goode and Emery Smiths’ clams;  Sounds like a conglomeration of every scifi movie from the last  80 years.  Although it’s entertaining and peppered with some truths I suspect, i feel their explanations for EVERYTHING extraterrestrial is just not plausible. I try to remain open minded, but people who talk about “facts” MUST be able to back up their claims. This is not happening.

Review.Titre: Subscribed to watch free videos entered…
Review.Contenu: Subscribed to watch free videos entered email multiple times yet not received any email and I'm not paying to subscribe at 75quid a year when I only want to watch 3 documentaries.

Review.Titre: Disappointing
Review.Contenu: Most of the new movies and documentaries are not available in Australia – there has not been a new movie listed for a long time…Not much new material of interest is available

Review.Titre: App does not perform well in iPhone
Review.Contenu: App does not perform well in iPhone. Can’t play content in background. No podcast options.Where is the new material? Why can’t I engage with other users on the damn platform

Review.Titre: Too far fetched
Review.Contenu: The majority of the content is so far fetched its ridiculous. A lot of the stuff revolves back to aliens and supernatural stuff. Just too far out there for me.

Review.Titre: I can't see the subtitles well and…
Review.Contenu: I can't see the subtitles well and there is no way to adjust them.  The selection of movies and shows doesn't change much- definitely need some new material.

Review.Pseudo: Dr. G Gerlach, PhD (Plasma Physics and QED)
Review.Titre: Gaia.com constantly crashes and
Review.Contenu: Gaia.com constantly crashes and, unfortunately unacceptably often, one cannot get back to the particular episode he was watching nor can it even be found despite exhaustive searching.  Worse, the essential programs pertaining to the roots of Gaia are rapidly becoming an ever increasing minority.  Fundamentally worthless or nonsensical programming is fast taking their place.  So much remains for Gaia to promote about our interstellar universe and much more along such lines, but is most definitely not being pursued.  Customer support is also completely non-existent.  Worse than disgusting.  People with first hand experience about our SSP and IDARF are no longer sought out and interviewed in depth as previously, instead replaced by the imaginary beliefs of self-proclaimed "experts" who present nothing more than unproven, unreferenced personal opinions.  Such can be found everywhere.

Review.Titre: Cost inconsistent with value.
Review.Contenu: You have great yoga content but you do not change the general programming often enough and you are the most expensive of all the channels that I purchase.

Review.Titre: Too many shows of the same subject…
Review.Contenu: Too many shows of the same subject matter by different people. Good in small doses. Also have technical issues that keep me from viewing at times

Review.Titre: I have not watched it in a while cause…
Review.Contenu: I have not watched it in a while cause I got bored. It seems to be repetitive things I have heard and i have learned nothing new.

Review.Titre: Gaia TV…
Review.Contenu: UPDATE: I just learned of DW resignation letter and I am very disappointed with ALL the exec's at the company!  To learn just how long & how bad things were behind the scenes; it proves the point I was making orig regarding Tom T Moore!  I am now re-thinking my subscription and how I feel about G tv.  Seems you are just LIKE any other corp with all the lies and deceit. How very sad, I fully believe you will loose your followers due to these practices.  To many now are awake and will not stand for it. ----Gaia TV is my absolute favorite place to watch informative TV.  I have numerous programs that I follow and look forward to each new episode.   That said; I believe the program director "team" or mgmt., should NOT hold programs back. I've been waiting for Tom T Moore's interview on Beyond Belief w/George Noory for over a year!! That is not only ridiculous but also very sad.  I still love my Gaia, however, it shows they're not so different than a reg holllywood production co.

Review.Titre: I am very disappointed in Gaia this…
Review.Contenu: I am very disappointed in Gaia this year as opposed to last year based on the content available. The Wilcock shows are the only reason I'm still watching at all.  Open Minds and Beyond Belief as also very good.  I also object strenuously to the way the subscriptions are applied annually w/ no options and no way to contact Gaia if we want to change credit cards or stop our subscription.  I have no interest in the yoga and drug shows that are so heavy in the lineup.  I suggest you find more ways to incorporate Christians into your wonderful information.  Dr Joye Pugh would be wonderful for a show.  I spent hours last year watching and this year maybe 4 hours a week.  I always watch Cosmic Disclosure and Wisdom Teachings but the price is high for 2 shows.  Vibratory information is vital now and we need your help to implement it.  Try to bring in people who can incorporate beliefs and not destroy baselines.  Good luck!  I wish I could help.  Your shows have been a great blessing to me and my learning experiences.  All good things!

Review.Titre: It took multiple tries to log in in…
Review.Contenu: It took multiple tries to log in in gaia.com even though I typed exactly what you said. I was unable to log in on my TV at all

Review.Titre: While I enjoyed some of gaia's content
Review.Contenu: While I enjoyed some of gaia's content, my main reason for subscribing was Kundalini yoga. Gaia has a small but decent selection of said content. Unfortunately, no new content has been added to this category in way over a year. Due to covid, I am no longer able to pay for their monthly service. I put my subscription on hold for 3 months in hopes of acquiring new employment and thus being able to resume my subscription. I was charged for the following month when it was suppose to be on hold. Their no refund policy is anything but fair. I recently cancelled an online course I paid for costing approximately $1200.00. I was over the cancellation period and was worried I would not receive a refund. The company immediately issued a refund, offered a huge discount on my next online course and wished me well. Thats the kind of service you would expect from a "spiritually" based company like Gaia not NO REFUND. Furthermore, since my cancellation of their service, every time I'm online, thats all I see is targeted adds from Gaia. Obviously, I have experienced targeted adds before. It's the huge number of adds I find astonishing. I will not be renewing my Gaia subscription.

Review.Titre: I renewed my subscription recently and…
Review.Contenu: I renewed my subscription recently and now cannot get on the site! Not sure how to contact customer service about this.

Review.Titre: Cancelled My Gaia Subscription Today
Review.Contenu: I was a Gaia subscriber for 2 or 3 years & had really enjoyed the experience -- a wide range of good content that streamed well via Roku. That has all changed! I cancelled my subscription today because in the past 30 days the service is "broke" more often than it works. I either get a message saying the service is "temporarily unavailable" or the little star that spins while content is loading just sits there & spins & spins & spins & the show fails to stream. I called customer support & they have absolutely no explanation as to why it won't stream or any guarantees it will be fixed. I asked to speak to someone who would know those answers & apparently nobody in the company does. That's sad! They don't seem to care very much about customer support. They did offer me 2 free months of service which I turned down. What good is free service if it doesn't work? I cancelled. I advise others to stay away from the service until they get their act together which it doesn't seem like they're very interested in doing.

Review.Titre: It's very white
Review.Contenu: It's very white, incredibly white. For people who claim love and light, it only seems to apply to white people.

Review.Titre: Streaming is often interrupted for long…
Review.Contenu: Streaming is often interrupted for long periods. This is very frustrating when you are in the midst of a yoga class.

Review.Titre: Good content, Bad support.
Review.Contenu: Good content. No one @ the wheel, you guys have the worst customer support I’ve ever encountered.

Review.Titre: Why am I paying both annual and monthly fees?
Review.Contenu: I like a lot of the programming Gaia offers, but I got a nonsensical answer when I asked why I have to pay monthly when I already pay an annual subscription fee.  Perhaps this opportunity will alert Gaia to this issue, as I feel certain I am not the only person with this experience.

Review.Titre: Improving Content
Review.Contenu: Need more content / interviews with people on extra terrestrial contact. Their purpose for coming. Also should cover spiritual mystics as a topic.

Review.Titre: Lots of good info but HATE the autoplay…
Review.Contenu: Lots of good info but HATE the autoplay video function. Can't find a way to turn it off and it ends with me falling asleep and waking with a dead phone.

Review.Titre: It's hit or miss
Review.Contenu: Some of the content, actually quite a lot of it feels like the type of stuff you'd find on YouTube.It's basically just a guy reading a long article while a slideshow of stock footage rolls across the screen.Other shows that are packaged as exciting series are nothing more than video podcasts.The documentaries category is good though, there's some good stuff there.

Review.Titre: Improved search functionality is needed
Review.Contenu: The topics covered on Gaia are wonderful but the search function is horrible. Example: I know that at one time I had watched an interview with Rosemarie Anderson, the author of Celtic Oracles, and wanted to watch is again but could not find it. Even when I only searched the word "Celtic" the results were completely unrelated. This has happened to me with numerous topics and is very frustrating.

Review.Titre: Good but missing a whole lot
Review.Contenu: I enjoy Gaia's content. But it is very repetitive. Very interview style focused. There is only so much I can watch before I tire of the whole thing.I would like to watch better documentaries and not so much of people talking AT me.

Review.Titre: Love the content
Review.Contenu: Love the content! but the mobile app - I find is hard to use.I need a video tutorial on how to orginise what I want to see on the mobile app. I would like to put a certain season of a series on favourites & just have that play. But When I choose something to watch, and then it skips to random things after that, instead of continuing to play the who series.

Review.Titre: More new content
Review.Contenu: I am completely happy with the old content of the site, especially the yoga pracrices with great teachers like Rodney Yee. The only reason i gave 3 stars is that I wish there would be more new content (like series and practices with more experienced teachers). Keep up the good work!

Review.Titre: Content is great, BUT!
Review.Contenu: Content is great. But the app for Android is just AWFUL. Like 2 years ago, no one cares. The app, or even video player on web page is constantly closing itself. I tried with 2 different phones. No, Gaia team, not only American iPhones are here, surprise! It's so disrespectful.

Review.Titre: I love Gaia and would give it 5 stars…
Review.Contenu: I love Gaia and would give it 5 stars but it lacks content.  After about 6 to 8 months I had watched most everything and they do not add a lot of new stuff.  I would recommend but not sure if I will keep my $100 annual subscription only to watch 1 or 2 new shows a week.

Review.Titre: I enjoyed the Ancient Civilizations…
Review.Contenu: I enjoyed the Ancient Civilizations series.  I don't like it when people start talking about THEIR OPINION instead of detailing the facts.

Review.Titre: I enjoy Gaia and have suggestions…
Review.Contenu: I enjoy Gaia and appreciate the diversity of programming with excellent interviewers like Regina. I think they could really improve the quality of new videos--They did some excellent series including Dr Joe, Robert Gilbert, Steven Greer. However this year they have done some boring programs with boring speakers like Lee Holden series and the ET series narrated by Regina was ok but kind of superficial. They have not anything really good for awhile.Not a lot of quality for awhile.Need more depth with more interesting expert presenters, like Billy Carson, Freddy Silva, Gregg Braden. Also Gaia needs to dump some boring films and get a lot of good ones--so many mediocre films and hardly ever new ones. Also I was very disappointed when they took away all the dates on their inteviews and programs leaving no idea when they were made.Also I think they should set up a system so folks can watch one Event and not have to get the entire season of lectures. I think they would make more money and get many new subscribers for Gaia.In general I am disappointed in the programming this past year--not as diverse, indepth, creative or interesting. Also Ancient Civilizations could be much better--too many interviewees and not enough depth. It is alittle of this and that--the speakers say alittle then on to another speaker . It is too general, could have much more depth. Need more top line interesting series and speakers. For awhile programming has seemed C quality. Nothing to learn deeply from--time for new fresh quality programs.

Review.Titre: I prefer programs that tell a personal…
Review.Contenu: I prefer programs that tell a personal story.  Many of your videos are lectures and although the info is important, it's boring.

Review.Titre: Same classes and meditations as when I signed up
Review.Contenu: I have been a Gaia member for quite a few years.   What I’ve noticed is very little new content.   I’m looking for updated meditation practices and new  yoga classes.

Review.Titre: Depends on Your Interest
Review.Contenu: I love it when they provide great information, but I dislike it when they talk and talk about nothing.

Review.Titre: New content is all via the paid events…
Review.Contenu: New content is all via the paid events now instead of part of the membership

Review.Titre: You guys don't put dates on anything
Review.Contenu: You guys don't put dates on anything! That's important to understand when the information was generated.

Review.Titre: The connection after 1 month Bad connection on smart tvis bad…
Review.Contenu: The connection after few months is bad when using smart tv

Review.Titre: Some good shows but not worth the…some Good Shows but to Expensive
Review.Contenu: Some good shows but not worth the annual subscription fee.

Review.Titre: Too Much Aliens and blue Chickens
Review.Contenu: Too Much Aliens and blue Chickens.   I miss Jay and Robert.   Gaia has been going down hill the last 5 years.

Review.Titre: Its repetitive
Review.Contenu: Its repetitive.  Somewhat over-stuffed with information and a bit boring at times.  PLUS the idea of having to pay 299 a year, all at once is daunting and discouraging.  I am thinking of canceling actually.

Review.Titre: play on TV without amazon
Review.Contenu: films only partly in English, with subtitles only. There is no way to watch it on TV without amazon.

Review.Titre: difficult no navegate the page
Review.Contenu: difficult no navegate the page, difficult to find my areas of interest

Review.Titre: I really enjoy most of the content…
Review.Contenu: For the most part I really enjoy most of the content. Although I find it frustrating that when watching a series it doesn't automatically continue.

Review.Titre: not enough new content per month…
Review.Contenu: not enough new content per month ....thats of interest to me ....

Review.Titre: Cosmic Disclosure
Review.Contenu: Cosmic Disclosure...need more interviewees and more shows...more alien topics...Antarctica experiences...

Review.Titre: Room for improvement!!!
Review.Contenu: I don’t find Gaia user friendly. It’s disorganized. Love most of the shows and very informative!!

Review.Titre: Streaming is spotty…would love more…
Review.Contenu: Streaming is spotty…would love more documentary/movie type shows. Love the content!!!

Review.Titre: Many programs have an aditional cost
Review.Contenu: Many programs have an aditional costMore Options in spanish

Review.Titre: I just subscribed to GAIA
Review.Contenu: I just subscribed to GAIA, their customer service was awesome, a bit more detail than I expected but it's ok.  I am going to give it a try since I am still in my 7 days trial period, I am hoping I don't have to go through any problems if I decide to cancel my membership somewhere down the line....

Review.Titre: Great content, weak streaming
Review.Contenu: I thoroughly enjoy the content offered by Gaia, however the functionality of the app leaves much to be desired. The buffering interruptions are so awful at times that I can't even finish the program I am trying to watch. I have a new device on a strong network and surprisingly it has not improved the streaming  quality at all. Again, great content but awful streaming.

Review.Titre: ??Lectures not movies??
Review.Contenu: My problem is I think I am going to watch a movie but then what I wind up trying to get thru is some person giving a lecture or talk. Not a movie, not even a bad movie. Just some person telling you something from their point of view, sometimes with a live audience sometimes not. Not what I expected at all. Not what I want. Maybe I will find something that will merit a $11.99 a month charge for access. I doubt it. I would rather read the information for myself, instead of watching someone walk around with a cup of something while fiddling with the top. Uuuggghh

Review.Titre: I love the content it offers but it is…
Review.Contenu: I love the content it offers but it is outdated...some of the movies being uploaded are 3-5 years old. I like the interviews but many of them are promotions of authors for their books which also have being published some years ago. Some of the interviews can be found on the internet for free.Some of the interviews are great and mention new points of view but there is no references or books or articles to back the information given...so one cannot deepen into the desired  topic.For the above reasons I find that the price of the membership is a bit on the high side.

Review.Titre: I am all for this channel
Review.Contenu: I am all for this channel . I mean I pay for it and it's about $12 a month which is very expensive for a single channel, most of their programming is okay, it does need a lot more variety, but there is one show in particular  called "initiation" with this guy...his name is Matias de Stefano and I am all for conspiracy theories and aliens and ancient Aliens and all of that but this guy is so full of BS, that I literally could not keep on watching this show he contradicts himself so much and he is just literally pulling BS out of his ass. Absolute garbage of a programming. Terrible.

Review.Titre: Amazing content. Faulty platform with bugs.
Review.Contenu: I LOVE the content on the platform however it doesn’t always work. Many times if you click a title it simply won’t open even though the “watch now” feature is able to be clicked, just goes no where. This is about 25% of the time maybe more and it’s SO frustrating. The redit boards say this happens often as well.  Once the shows are viewable it will be 5 stars for sure.

Review.Titre: Awesome!  But too heavy on the UFO/Aliens material.
Review.Contenu: I love much of the content but it's too heavy on the UFO/Aliens content.  Also, the search engine function (specifically for the Sacred Mysteries DVD series) does not work effectively. With the exception of Regina Meredith (love her!) it seems new content does not come in very often.  Sometimes I wonder if it's worth keeping the membership.  Seems I can leave it for 2 months and maybe when I come back there might be a new movie or series.

Review.Titre: 5 Star Content - 1 Star Platform
Review.Contenu: Content is amazing and would be a 5 star review based solely on this parameter. However, as amazing as the content is, the delivery platform is frustrating, substandard, and frankly has me second guessing my subscription monthly. I can only satisfactorily watch on a laptop. Phone and iPad...clocking and crashing. Contacted support and they insist that it is a conmention and device issue. These same devices have no issues streaming any other platform. No app available for smart tv's.

Review.Titre: The content is amazing
Review.Contenu: The content is amazing! So rich and powerful. All the series and docs I’m watching are incredible. The thing I’m having trouble with is the technical stuff. The platform is not friendly, like it’s hard to follow a series, to look for episodes, to continue watching where I left something, etc. Like I feel it’s lacking in organization, like it could be more friendly. Thank you

Review.Titre: Samsung Smart TV app
Review.Contenu: Gaia is wonderful but the Samsung smart tv app needs work. The auto play function causes bugs. Video distorts into a variation of green and digital noise while audio is unaffected. This happens frequently at the beginning of episodes loading. Thank You.

Review.Titre: I wish it was easier to navigate and…
Review.Contenu: I wish it was easier to navigate and search for content. The stuff I see on Google is impossible to find on Gaia. Even though it says it's part of a series. It gets to the point that it's not worth the effort sometimes. What's there is good content and worth watching. I just wish I could find the programs I got Gaia for.

Review.Titre: I now rarely am able to watch a show…
Review.Contenu: I now rarely am able to watch a show fully without it pausing to refresh or whatever it does! Often it takes so long to come on, plays for 5-10 seconds and goes through the process again. Invariably I turn it off.It has made me rethink my subscription as it is very slow and or frustrating to watch.

Review.Titre: I just want to humbly share my…
Review.Contenu: I just want to humbly share my experience. Maybe it was cause i had many expectation, and that is never a good thing. I just thought i would find it much more interesting. I just would have loved more scientific insight to explain all the mystical and magical, just cause i'm a very emotional person so i need some rational knowledge to balance. Saying this, i watch many series and docs. And i really enjoy them. I just found a lot of content very.. plain. No offences, just want to give you my personal honest opinion. All the Love

Review.Titre: Feedback from a non English spoken (native) user
Review.Contenu: I strongly recommend you to perform a benchmark exercise against Netflix to make more user friendly the appAll contents should have subtitles in Spanish Subtitles in white are not easy to watch, yellow is a better option Why I should change my cellphone language to have access to more contents? I should have access to everything regardless what language I have on my cellphone settingsMove from one video to other should be easier

Review.Titre: Lots of the shows are several years old…
Review.Contenu: Lots of the shows are several years old and it's hard to find the dates on some of the write ups for the shows. I also find navigating the site somewhat frustrating and when I find something I'd like to see, but don't open it immediately (to browse another topic) I find it next to impossible to get back to (unless I happen to remember the exact name of the show)

Review.Titre: Updated & New Content Needed
Review.Contenu: I love GAIA and I feel that I have viewed everything of interest to m several times.  I would like more updated and current content for me to feel that subscribing is worthwhile.  I enjoyed the series Interviews with Extra Dimensionals and would love to see a follow up to this series, as it is my understanding this series is now about 10 years old. Thank you for hearing me, and I will give Gaia some time before deciding to continue my subscription.

Review.Titre: A bit overwhelming
Review.Contenu: While it is a good place, I'm finding it overwhelmingly lot of information and I don't get to visit any other than the guided meditations.For that reason I'm contemplating to unsubscibe.Having said that, Rodney Yee's 10 min Morning meditation for gratitude is the best short meditation I have ever come across! I'm so grateful for it.Namaste

Review.Titre: The shows on this platform are subpar
Review.Contenu: The shows on this platform are subpar. I tried very hard to get into the shows since there seems to be a good amount of variety. Most of the shows are “talk shows” and quite frankly boring. I lost interest very quickly which was such a shame! I hope they put better content so I can join again. Only show worth watching here is Initiation.

Review.Titre: Its okay!
Review.Contenu: I like Gaia, don't love it.  I find some of the shows a little over the top in terms of content.  I really just use it for yoga classes.  Unfortunately, I don't think the ratings for class difficulty are very reliable.  A level 2 from some teachers is ridiculously easy while with other teachers they are super hard.  So the level of difficulty which should be the most useful filter is actually useless.Other than that, I like the instructors and the fact that I can choose what length of class or what area I want to focus on.

Review.Titre: Tks + improvements
Review.Contenu: - Material is great- Could be better organized- Make it easier to keep watching next episode of show you just watched last-  Gaia, for some reason, is always slower than other apps when it comes to streaming shows. Sometimes the loading symbol in the middle of the screen never disappears...- Thank you for the opportunity to have easy access to all this info✨

Review.Titre: Hard to find the good stuff
Review.Contenu: I enjoy the spiritual documentaries. The app is a bit antiquated. There isn't even a "start from beginning" if you want to restart a show. You have to wait until the whole thing rewinds. It's like having a VHS player 😄. Also there are a bunch of wacky low budget interview format videos. Get rid of most of these. They lower the quality of your network. There is plenty of other content. Less is more.

Review.Titre: I'm missing the screen on screen…
Review.Contenu: I'm missing the screen on screen function. And the live access is extra. The normal shows are great but not as deeply informative as the live access ones and those you can only access the first but it does not say only the first one is free to whatch then when wanting to see the next ones in the series you find an upgrade button that does does not work. (also a bit over priced for my pocket)So still a work in progress. But still love it!

Review.Titre: New payment plan...?
Review.Contenu: Paying $13/month or even the full lump sum up front is too much for what I need Gaia for. Of course I would love to watch more of all the great media offered, but with school and work and personal studies it is hard. And I really only seek out what I need. Perhaps there could be a middle payment plan where you pay for what you want to watch. I’m paying monthly for a subscription I can’t fully utilize And while I want to support you it is too expensive.

Review.Titre: Hello my name is Brent
Review.Contenu: Hello my name is Brent, to start i would like to say i really enjoy Gaia.com and all that this team stands for. Thank you. The only problem i am facing is not being able to select any of the videos from any of the series. When i click on the "view episodes" tab, i am not able to view or click on any of them. I hope i have made sense and hope this can be resolved soon.  Have a good day.Thank you, BrentC.S.

Review.Titre: Even though I enjoy the content
Review.Contenu: Even though I enjoy the content, I got disappointed when I tray to watch a show and ask me to upgrade, considering the monthly membership is not that cheap, Its more that Netflix. I understand everybody has to make a living. but whats the point of paying monthly    and have to pay more later, Im finishing watching the series Im currently in right now and cancelling my subscription.

Review.Titre: Thank you Gaia, please get back to where you were.  You now have competion snapping at your heals.
Review.Contenu: I have been with Gaia TV for quite a few years now and have enjoyed all of its content. My wife and I have enjoyed the amazing programs that has challenged our thinking.  I love it when people challenge my world.  Sadly though over the last 2 years I think its become stale.  Don't get me wrong, if people are coming to this for the first time it has a large libary of excellent programms.  I feel the latest work and ideas seem to have fallen off.  Thank you Gaia, please get back to where you were.  You now have competion snapping at your heals.

Review.Titre: Roku Improvements?
Review.Contenu: The content on Gaia is good, my specific issue is with the Roku app, where shows I have completed litter the continue watching swim lane. I also wish my playlist had a swimlane instead of a menu item, and that the episodes from my playlist that have been watched either were labeled as such, or had an option to be auto-removed after being watched, similar to a podcast app. Thanks Gaia.

Review.Titre: Difficult to find the good stuff…
Review.Contenu: Difficult to sort out the good stuff because there's so much nonsense.I think it's overpriced -- a lot of US content isn't available in the UK, and a lot of the other shows are all a bit samey. You can probably watch most of the good stuff within the first month, and after that you'll probably end up bored.I'd say it's probably worth more like £3.00 a month rather than what they actually charge -- although I'd rather see an ad supported version.

Review.Titre: I love the content but....
Review.Contenu: I love the content, but from someone who does not have unlimited data, this app is a nightmare. It will do everything in its power to make sure it is using data instead of my on device downloads. Also it makes it very cumbersome to download episodes sequentially. Like a deliberate maze....

Review.Titre: When we try to communicate with…
Review.Contenu: When we try to communicate with customer service for issues with payment, we don't get an answer. It's very complicated to find contact info. When one tries to reach customer service, they don't want a FAQ options to read. Most, did it first. So, it would be good to give correct info to reach someone, a real agent, not a robot. And please, don't send an email with the FAQS. It doesn't solve the problems.

Review.Titre: I love the programs on Gaia
Review.Contenu: I love the programs on Gaia, however the video platform itself is sometimes not as intuitive as I would like.Such as selecting the duration of the video on the filter, I would like to be able to choose say 30mins then choose 20mins directly instead of going back to the 'all' duration or clearing the filter before picking another duration.Thanks Gaia!

Review.Titre: Missing info from African Cultures
Review.Contenu: Most of the selections are fascinating and timeworthy.  I feel I have invested wisely.  However I am curious and in some cases disappointed in the lack of diversity in terms of offerings from indigenous cultures of Africa.  The selections which could reference spiritual, paranormal and/or alternative healing practices rooted in Africa are noticeably absent.

Review.Titre: I love your programs
Review.Contenu: I love your programs, the variety and most up to date information of most programs as well as the sincere and professional presenters.  It works to send new programs or episodes via email.  It feels like your mission also includes information and hope for a better world and the connections thereof.  Thank you. I am wondering when in terms of scheduling the next season of  Initiation by Matias de Stefano is? I heard it would be at the beginning of the year and it is now April. Can you get back to me on this question.  Appreciate that.

Review.Titre: Some good stuff
Review.Contenu: Like the website, disappointed in the claim that you get a week of free live access to see if you are interested. It only let me watch one episode. When I contacted customer support received an canned response that did not address my question just told me how to sign up for live access. Disappointing and didn't appreciate the bait and  switch tactic.

Review.Titre: I'd like to see more current programs and see year created  more easily
Review.Contenu: I love the type of programs you have and for this alone I would rate Gaia as 5 stars  though grateful such a channel exists I find many of the programs dated, old .. this is not an issue when it has quality content however I have an expectation that I will have choice in programs that are very currentI BELIEVE I COULD BETTER assess the value of Gaia if I could easily see the dates of publication and creation of the programs offered.. I would prefer to see the date in the title.I really hope more people ask for this as it is deal breaker over time for me

Review.Titre: I hardly utilize my Gaia account~
Review.Contenu: I hardly utilize my Gaia account~I cannot really discern what is truth from what is conspiracy theory. There are a few programs that I have enjoyed, but not $100 worth. I want to learn more about the metaphysical and magicks... while there is content there, I just cannot see paying another $100 to renew.

Review.Titre: Content is amazing however usability of…
Review.Contenu: Content is amazing however usability of the website and app are not great. Features to stream onto other devices would be great I find constant gitches. it wont recognize that i have an account on some platforms. others after clicking around ill finally open a tab that allows me to continue on my account.

Review.Titre: Love the programmes but get so…
Review.Contenu: Love the programmes but get so frustrated when casting it to the tv, it freezes. Wouldn’t be so bad if it was just once or twice but it’s every minute or so.  It takes over an hour to watch a half hour episode.  We have paid for a year up front and will consider not renewing.

Review.Titre: I do like Gaia with it's highly interesting topics
Review.Contenu: I do like Gaia with it's highly interesting material, but when watching a series such as Cosmic Disclosure the next episode doesn't start automatidally or I cannot work out the last episode watched. The next episode sometimes jumps to an episode we've already watched or points to the next episode being an episode we watched some time back. Casting to the TV is sometimes a real difficult process. I someetimes feel that we are being exposed to a Conspiricy created by Google/Android/ GAIA!? Please look at and fix the frustrating issues we do love GAIA mostly.

Review.Titre: Wonderful videos - crappy site
Review.Contenu: Basic video's are enjoyable to view and learn from. Your online site basically stinks..Clunky and difficult to control video's. Actually everything about your site leaves a lot to be desired.Application for watching you site on TV is the same clunky and just a pain to work through and control not at all logical and easy flowing. Weather it's worth another 1 yr subscription remains to be seen and that's a shame. Your site really deserves a -1 start rating if not for many interesting videos, once their found...

Review.Titre: The programming is great, video issues
Review.Contenu: The programming is great. The reason for the 3 stars is I have to reload Gaia 1 to 4 times. Doing this is because the loading stoped or when playing about 3 or 4 seconds I get a totally scattered screen and back to normal. This issue is very consistent.

Review.Titre: There needs to be ongoing new content
Review.Contenu: There needs to be ongoing new content. I also dont like how you have to upgrade to access certain recordings. I feel like the amount I spent up front was an investment enough AND I wasn’t clearly told that I would have had to pay more.

Review.Titre: Although I love the subjects showed on…
Review.Contenu: Although I love the subjects showed on GAIA, I get really confused on how they recycle the shows under a different name. Some Shows have so many seasons, and yet, I've never seem them before; which makes me believe that they just recycled the episode under a different name.And when you try to look for previous seasons, to start from say "Season 1, ep.1" it's impossible to find???It's very confusing... even if you search under the host's name, it shows so many different shows with the same host...

Review.Titre: Clunky platform
Review.Contenu: Great content, really useful and worthwhile but the platform is really clunky and annoying, like something from 15-20 years ago - seriously guys, spend a few hundred bucks and get your IT people to fix it so that episodes of series are easy to locate and that one episode flows straight into the next. This is particularly relevant when watching meditation content where you don't want to have to wake up and physically try and find the next episode all the time. Apart from that keep up the good work.

Review.Titre: Great topics - only men as experts???
Review.Contenu: I just joined Gaia and the topics of the documentaries seem to be great . Watched 3 and all of them had SOLEY men talking as experts about science, spirituality etc. I know that there are numerous amazing and inspiring women out there and wish and expect of a platform like Gaia to demonstrate a healthy balance.

Review.Titre: Content is very good
Review.Contenu: Content is very good, realy eye opening.Navigation true content is poor.And the videoplayer on mij iphone struggles.Downloaded content mostly freezes the picture and the audio continues playing.(iPhone)There is no mode for listening only when the phone is locked.I hope they partner with a beter website builder.

Review.Titre: It’s hard to discern the good from the crazy
Review.Contenu: It is very hard to discern the good content from the abundant craziness. Ratings don’t help much probably because their average customer believes in anything they see. I think text reviews would help a lot

Review.Titre: I love the app, but...
Review.Contenu: I love the app, although it doesn't seem compatible with my Fire Stick. When I launch it and choose programming, it buffers for a long time. I've been trouble shooting this for months, I even upgraded my Wifi to an Amplifi Mesh System. Nothing is helping.

Review.Titre: Too much buffering
Review.Contenu: I stream from many sites for movies, news and content similar to Gaia. Out of all of them,  Gaia is the one that buffers the most, which for me, wastes the most time and skips the most content.I don't have that much knowledge of the technology behind using your cell phone as a hot spot so I don't know if it's Gaia or my carrier that's causing this frustration. All I know is that Gaia is the one that buffers so much I frequently switch to another site because I can't watch Gaia's content. This is especially frustrating because I am paying for Gaia's subscription and the others are free. Therefore, I doubt I will renew my subscription.

Review.Titre: DO THE MATH!!!
Review.Contenu: Well for starters I haven't signed up yet and others may find this observation to be petty.  The add states that you get 12 months for the price of 9 months for the annual subscription cost of $99.00. Well I am no mathematician by any means but I can add. So if you add sales tax to the $99.00 it totals $107.17 and if you multiply the monthly subscription cost of $11.99 by 9 months plus tax the cost is $116.82.  So by this calculation the annual subscription is the best deal, but don't say that it is 12 months for the price of 9 whenever it is clearly not. That's all I am saying here.Thank you

Review.Titre: Content is varied and awesome. App needs improvement.
Review.Contenu: Content is varied and awesome. I love that I have tons of interesting options to choose from. But random bugs sometimes, are keeping me from watching what I want, when I want it. I'm talking about the Android app. There are days when I can't see anything, and wait for a "good day".

Review.Titre: 1 year member
Review.Contenu: 1 year member: Although I think some of the content is great, there remains some interface struggles that hamper the total product. About a year in now, and I have seen most all of the actually credible and current material offered. The interface and search options are very clunky and difficult to navigate. Shows are not grouped together as they should be and finding certain items can be frustrating. Overall, Gaia is my go to for enlightening content and self help items. That said, the presentation and functionality of the channel could use a facelift. Super happy I subscribed Gaia, it has literally been life changing for me. Thank you!

Review.Titre: Bait and switch, self-absorbed interviewers
Review.Contenu: There are some worthwhile things here. And some odd things. But it feels like a bait and switch when you pay a fee for the service and then are asked to pay more for certain videos. Also, I find some of the interviewers to talk too much about what they think. If you’re watching an interview, you don’t care what the host’s personal views are. You just want to hear from a certain guest — that’s why you’re clicking on that video. The hosts should learn that it’s not about them. I’m disappointed and not sure how long I’ll stick with Gaia.

Review.Titre: I think the Programms Gaia offers are…
Review.Contenu: I think the Programms Gaia offers are great, the documentaries and clases. But the Web Page and App are really slow, they will Stop and start constantly and when I want to go back it Always send me to the home page. I so have fast Internet but with Gaia is never enough.

Review.Titre: Disappointing discovery
Review.Contenu: After seeing friends subscribing Gaia, through my spiritual journey, I found this to be a great tool for spiritual growth. As I have been diving into all kind of subjects two particular characters started to seem a little phony. Emery Smith and David Wilcox. So I started doing research and man was I right. These two individuals are scam artists and I am very disappointed to see how Gaia is allowing these folks run their disinformation filled shows. Any spiritual individual can simply sense their narcissism and opportunistic energy through the screen. Does Gaia not check character credentials before allowing these kind of criminals continue with shows in this presumably spiritual platform?

Review.Titre: I love Gaia but I feel like some people…
Review.Contenu: I love Gaia but I feel like some people lose credibility when you let just anyone be on the show. I can hear from someone very educated and then change the show and hear from a quack right after. That kinda ruins it for me.

Review.Titre: I love the content, not a fan of the functionality
Review.Contenu: I love the content but I'm not a fan of the user interface format on the Amazon firebox platform.  I regularly an stuck on the very attractive loading screen.  Often I will have to back out of a program and restart just to get the loading screen to end when the program starts or the system will just stall out on the load screen. I pay more per month for this than Hulu or Netflix and while I love the content, I often don't watch it because it fails to run.  In addition, not being able to access my Account through Playstation PS4 or the Xbox one means I can't watch or share Gaia at my girlfriends house or scram friends houses

Review.Titre: I love Gaia
Review.Contenu: Don't get me wrong I love Gaia! But if there would be more documentaries I would have 4 starred it 😉 a more user friendly interface searching for specific material would make me give it 5 stars!!! But, I'm Gaia all the way!

Review.Titre: I am a member but I don't get any…
Review.Contenu: I am a member but I don't get any emails or communication regarding my interests. Sometimes I suffer depression and I am distracted and I dont remember Gaia. It would be good if you reminded me to watch something from time to time.

Review.Titre: The concept is great
Review.Contenu: The concept is great. The execution is off. At least it is over here as the program itself is very glitchy on a regular basis. I click a program to watch, it wont load. I get a black screen for minutes and have to close Gia and jump back in to try again. This may occur 2-3x before the show will play correctly. Other times when it does load and Im watching, its doing this glitchy thing where it zooms in and out. Im sure you've heard this before. Im not sure how else to describe but it in a rhythmic pattern will zoom in and magnify just a portion of the screen before bouncing back out to the full screen as it should be... seconds later it does it again. repeat. never ends. have to close out Gia and relaunch.  So great as it is. the experience is frustrating and interface glitchy.

Review.Titre: Tons of content but lack of diversity
Review.Contenu: I love all the educational content! However my only issue is the huge and noticeable lack of diversity in the programs! As I have watch tons of movies and videos 98% of the people I viewed were Caucasian. There seems to have been zero representation of any other races on the majority of the programs. This was difficult to explain why to my children, with all of the content that derived from other ethnicities why only Caucasians were the ones presenting theories and facts. It’s 2021 this should not be so. There are plenty of diverse races and cultures that are historians and researchers. If this was addressed and resolved I see my review being five stars easy!!!

Review.Titre: Too expensive for a world in an economic depression.

Review.Titre: Almost perfect!
Review.Contenu: I'm a huge Gaia fan, and a walking advertisement for it! I do have a few suggestions for their webmaster - procedural weaknesses on the site that make navigating difficult and irritating. ("First World" problems!)   :]1) "Continue watching" leaps to the next ("Suggested for you") episode - not the one (incompleted) most recently watched.2) There's one unnecessary step in the "Continue watching" sequence.3) When one searches by "Series" - as an alternative to finding the most recently watched bookmarked episode, because the above procedure is too time-consuming - the viewer's favorite and most-watched series should be at the top of the list - not buried under a pile of never-watched ones.4) The site should offer a permanent setting for captions. The setting needs to be constantly reset over different viewing sessions.5) "Accept cookies" question is a permanent feature. It doesn't respond and disappear with an answer - it's a permanent feature of logging in, every single time. If it weren't for the above, Gaia definitely rates 5 stars!!!  ...offering a veritably lifelong cornucopia of incredibly valuable, uplifting, informative, professional videos. I brag about Gaia at every opportunity.

However, there are times when I find that the algorithms limit the options of programs I may consider watching and I find navigating the series slightly complicated. Aside from those little snafus we think that your streaming service is great! Thank you Gaia, for giving our inquiring minds an alternative to Netflix!

Review.Titre: lethargic archeology
Review.Contenu: I got the channel mostly for a few of the popular series you have but since the series I watch have not released new episodes I just re-watch the ones I've seen.  I prefer a documentary setup rather than an interview when I watch your content.  I watch Ancient Teachings and anything that is not a conversation between 2 people but more of a lesson.  I would appreciate any suggestions.  I do enjoy the channel and the only thing I could say is that I'm anxious for more discoveries and the teachings to follow.

Review.Titre: Mostly top notch but sometimes repetitive and lacks actual cultural experts
Review.Contenu: While I do enjoy the original programs on Gaia, there aren't enough of them! I feel that Gaia ought to branch out a bit more, it seems to be the same experts over and over with the same sorts of topics. I would also like to see experts who are actually from the cultures that the topics are about. For instance; many of your hosts talk about research they have done on Meso American pre hispanic cultures yet none of your hosts are actually from those cultures nor is their research from an actual indigenous source.

It's fine if I have already something in my Watch Later or Continue Watching, but if I'm looking for something new and specific the search tool is quite obsolete, making it slow to find what I'm looking for.

Review.Titre: "Cultivating Wisdom: A Profound Exploration of Gaia's Knowledge Repository"
Review.Contenu: As a child, I had the privilege of having a set of encyclopedias prominently displayed in our family's living room. Those volumes were a constant source of fascination, offering a wealth of knowledge that never failed to pique my curiosity. It was as though any question I harbored could be answered within the confines of those books. Gaia, much like those cherished encyclopedias, has the remarkable ability to captivate my intellectual pursuits. It boasts an extensive reservoir of information that not only satiates my thirst for knowledge but also leaves me yearning for further exploration.
